messages.message: Sixfold (commercial customer) is trying to extract out from excel files and is having limited success. We think that allowing them to process excel files natively will be very beneficial for them - and will be critical as they compare us against other alternatives for extraction. Is it possible to give them early access by using our org feature flagging? cc: @Rakesh @Aayush @lydia

cc: @Balaram
Is it failing to process and upload files ?
Also what type of extraction they are trying to do ? Field or tables  ?

They're trying to extract all instances of property addresses and attributes about the properties. What they've found is that the prompts they're using are missing rows (which @Dale DeLoy believes may be due to OCR issues). The thought is that ideally processing as native excels will help to ensure that we minimize any OCR issues and can ensure we capture all values
@Dale DeLoy can definitely add more and will have access to sample files

Hmm, not sure how the org feature flagging works, the feature flag for this is `AIHUB_ENABLE_NATIVE_EXCEL_PROCESSING` and is set to `IB_OPT_OUT` in AI Hub with the new feature flag system. We can test the sample files and prompts internally and see if that resolves the issues they are facing.
With my early testing, I don't think this feature is ready for customers to try yet. I often run into backend failures, so I don't think it'll be a good experience.
Ok got it. Thanks @lydia! If that's the case then @Dale DeLoy would be great to see if there's anything we can do to test this out and then give them a report back on it.
I have the sample docs and am building out using Native Excel and OCR with No Visual Objects.  Will let all know how it goes.

With native excel files feature, our goal was to reduce the digitisation time for the excel files and we are seeing good improvements with it.

We have encountered the below limitations with extraction during our testing:

• While extracting the entire table data for excel files with more than 800-1000 rows and 30 columns, the model response was not complete. We are working with TDF team to figure out this issue. 
    ◦ PS: If we extract 4-5 columns from the table, then we are able to extract more than 5000 rows
• While displaying the extracted data, because of the number of rows and columns there is a lag on the front end 
I have created a build project for one of the documents shared by @Dale DeLoy and table extraction looks good.

https://aihub.instabase.com/build/01913321-f778-7c8d-8be9-0ba1e23872f6

@lydia Can you please update the issues in the ticket? This will help us to track and close it. The issue with table field which was reported yesterday is a regression. With Vishnu's fix even that should be addressed.
yup I've been commenting in the EPD ticket with all the issues I've run into
@Balaram can you give me access to the project? I'm curious what prompts you tried
@lydia I have created this project under the workspace "table-dataset" and when I checked the workspace you had the access. Are you facing any issue while accessing it?
Yea I get an access denied. I don't see this workspace in the list of ones I have access to. Here's my prod user
This account (<mailto:lydia@instabase.com|lydia@instabase.com>) was added to the workspace. I have added the above account now.
Really appreciate all the effort going into processing large Excel files.  We are seeing good success with documents of 1000 rows or less!

Also seeing dramatic speed improvements for loading large Excel docs closer to 10,000 rows!  Issue we still have is the large table extraction from Excel were the table result is 5,000 + rows and 90 columns wide (current Nationwide ask)
@Dale DeLoy We are aware of the issue with extracting the entire data from the table with 5,000+ rows and 40+ columns. We are working with the model team to find a solution.
